title: 115_s3424
content: The Act may be cited as the "Retirement Investments for a Sustainable Economy Act of 2018" or the "RISE Act of 2018." Congress acknowledges the importance of sustainable investments. Congress recognizes the threat of climate change to the economy and population of the United States, as well as the risks it poses to pension and retirement funds, including climate impact, carbon-constrained demand, and climate liability risks. The urgent concern lies in assessing the potential impact of climate-related risks on financial systems, including retirement savings accounts and pensions. The Climate Choice Stock Index Fund is established. The Climate Choice Stock Index Fund is defined as an entity in the amended Section 8438 of title 5, United States Code. The term 'fossil fuel entity' is defined as any entity with proven carbon reserves or involved in the exploration, extraction, processing, refining, or transmission of coal, oil, gas, oil shale, or tar sands. The Board will establish a Climate Choice Stock Index Fund invested in common stock to replicate the performance of a recognized index. The fund's historical performance must be comparable to other investment options available. The Board will establish a Climate Choice Stock Index Fund invested in common stock to replicate the performance of a recognized index. The fund aims to evenly distribute investments in each stock based on market value and prohibits investments in fossil fuel entities. SEC. 4. GOVERNMENT ACCOUNTABILITY OFFICE REPORT. The Comptroller General of the United States will submit a report to Congress analyzing the proportion of stocks, bonds, and obligations held by the Thrift Savings Fund that are related to fossil fuel entities and the impact on account holders under climate policies to limit global temperature increase. The proposed plan aims to limit global temperature increase to 2 degrees Celsius by utilizing available technology and economically feasible measures. It also includes a mechanism for the Federal Retirement Thrift Investment Board to divest from fossil fuel entities to protect account holders in the Thrift Savings Fund from negative investment risks.
